anime.description: * Based on http://anidb.net/cr14784 [Mori Eto]`s youth novel series DIVE!! The story revolves around the Mizuki Diving Club (MDC), which is on the verge of closing down after having financial troubles. The club`s new coach persuades the club`s parent company to stay open on one condition: that the club sends one of its members to next year`s olympics as part of Japan`s olympic team. Source: ANN Note: The first episode was digitally distributed by Amazon Japan one day before the regular TV broadcast, which started on 07.07.2017.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: novel
tag.description: A novel is a relatively long work of narrative fiction, normally written in prose form, and which is typically published as a book. Manga, comics, or visual novels do not fit this description and are not considered novels; including a small number of illustrations, however, is still permissible, which means that light novels are considered novels.

tag.name: sports
tag.description: Sports anime revolves around a recreational physical activity or skill. In addition they often adhere to certain genre conventions, the emphasis on training and practice in preparation for competition, characters desire for self improvement, and pursuit of a specific goal.

tag.name: noitaminA
tag.description: noitaminA (ノイタミナ) – Animation written backwards – is a Fuji Television programming block, devoted to anime, broadcast each Thursday night from 00:45 to 1:15. It was launched with the intention of expanding the target audience beyond the typical young male demographic. The timeslot was expanded from half an hour to a full hour in 2010, and now airs Thursday nights from 00:45 to 1:45. noitaminA aired its first non-anime series in 2010, with the premiere of the live-action adaptation of Moyashimon. On April 15, 2010, Fuji TV and FUNimation announced an agreement that allows FUNimation to simulcast series from the noitaminA block in North America within an hour of their airing in Japan.

tag.name: Olympics
tag.description: The Olympic Games play a significant part in the plot. Either one or more characters dream(s) of going to the Olympics (as either a competitor or spectator), or part of the anime takes place at the Olympics. Japan has hosted the Olympics three times: the 1964 Summer Olympics in Tokyo; the 1972 Winter Olympics in Sapporo, Hokkaidō Prefecture; and the 1998 Winter Olympics in Nagano, Nagano Prefecture, so do not be surprised when shows set during these time periods have a significant showing of the Olympics. Olympic parodies may also count, so long as it is a significant part of the plot.

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: multi-anime projects
tag.description: Many anime are created as part of larger projects encompassing many shows without direct relation to one another. Normally, there is a specific idea in mind: for example, the http://anidb.net/t4859 [Young Animator Training Project] aims to stimulate the on-the-job training of next-generation professionals of the anime industry, whereas the http://anidb.net/t3763 [World Masterpiece Theatre] aims to animate classical stories from all over the world.

tag.name: acrobatic diving
tag.description: Acrobatic diving, or simply diving, is the sport of jumping or falling into water from a platform or springboard, usually while performing acrobatics. Diving is an internationally recognized sport that is part of the Olympic Games. In addition, unstructured and non-competitive diving is a recreational pastime. It is not to be confused with http://anidb.net/t4267 [underwater diving]. Source: Wikipedia

episode.title: THE STRONG MEN
The Strong Men
The Strong Men
episode.summary: It`s the Golden Week holiday, and combined practice with veteran divers begins! They are an eclectic bunch including one diver named Yamada A.K.A. Pinky who views Yoichi as a rival for some reason. Tomoki enthusiastically embraces the higher level of practice, but... Source: amazon

episode.title: ENTER SHIBUKI
Enter Shibuki
Enter Shibuki
episode.summary: Kayoko has brought Shibuki Okitsu, a young man who was raised in the ocean waters of Tsugaru. Everyone at MDC is awed by his dynamic style, which is in complete contrast to Yoichi`s perfect technique. One day, Kayoko tells Tomoki to perform a "three-and-a-half" for the meet in July... Source: amazon

episode.title: CONCENTRATION DRAGON
Concentration Dragon
Concentration Dragon
episode.summary: The Olympics. That was what Kayoko`s condition was for the continuation of MDC. Everyone is a little hesitant in accepting her as the new coach, but Tomoki throws himself into the practice given to him. Meanwhile, another young man visits MDC. Source: amazon

episode.title: DIVE TO BLUE
Dive to Blue
Dive to Blue
episode.summary: Tomoki Sakai is a second year junior high student who dedicates every day to diving. It all began years ago when he was drawn in by the beautiful diving of Yoichi Fujitani, a boy three years his senior. Tomoki goes to the Mizuki Diving Club (MDC) with his friends Ryo and Reiji, but everything changes when the mysterious woman Kayoko Asaki appears... Source: amazon

episode.title: SO I ENVY YOU!
So I Envy You!
So I Envy You!
episode.summary: Shibuki left a letter before returning to Tsugaru. He doesn`t get much of a chance to spend time with his girlfriend Kyoko and his family before Tomoki and Yoichi suddenly appeared after returning from their training camp in Beijing. The three friends are enjoying something different from their usual practice, but then they deliver a DVD Kayoko had asked them to hand to Shibuki... Source: amazon

episode.title: DEAR FRIENDS
Dear Friends
Dear Friends
episode.summary: Having finished fourth in the meet, Tomoki has never felt so bitter and dejected in his life. In other news, Shibuki injured his hip during the meet, and Ryo ended up with disappointing results. They each take time to reflect before embarking on a new path. Source: amazon

episode.title: DIAMOND EYES
Diamond Eyes
Diamond Eyes
episode.summary: Tomoki is unable to get over the shock of losing his girlfriend to his younger brother. The club is competing in an upcoming meet, and Kayoko has grown impatient with Tomoki as he`s failed to show up to MDC, and she tells him that he is a natural born diver. Source: amazon

episode.title: THE DAYS OF GRAY
The Days of Gray
The Days of Gray
episode.summary: Ryo and Reiji feel like Kayoko is playing favorites with Tomoki. Tomoki feels sad at the change in attitudes of his two friends. Unable to stand by and do nothing, Yoichi calls Tomoki over on their way home. Source: amazon

episode.title: FINAL STAGE
Final Stage
Final Stage
episode.summary: Yoichi had decided to turn down his free ticket to the Olympics, opting to compete in the qualifiers against his friends instead. With his national rivals joining in the combined practice, the Olympic qualifiers are about to begin! Source: amazon

episode.title: MEET THE MONSTER
Meet the Monster
Meet the Monster
episode.summary: Tomoki was working hard to learn a new move when he injured himself during practice. Yoichi came by to check on him and is moved by Tomoki`s tremendous passion for diving. Having made up his mind, Yoichi decides to visit the chairman of the Japan Swimming Federation. Source: amazon

episode.title: NEXT STAGE COMING
Next Stage Coming
Next Stage Coming
episode.summary: Yoichi was unexpectedly chosen for the Olympics. As his parents and other MDC members congratulate him, he is unable to hide his own hesitation. Meanwhile, Shibuki had returned to MDC, taking up ballet as a form of training, and Tomoki began practicing a new move. Source: amazon

episode.title: CONCRETE DRAGON
Concrete Dragon
Concrete Dragon
episode.summary: Pushing himself too hard every day has put Yoichi off his game. The MDC members are hesitant, but each one heads towards the platform with resolve. The crowd roars in excitement as one incredible performance follows another, when it`s time for Tomoki`s final dive. He leaps off the platform, searching for the view only he can see... Source: amazon
